page.title: 17NEWS & HISTORY/2
page.content:
(continued) was Edna Lyall.She died February 8th 1903.In Bosbury church there is a screen, at the bottom of the screen there are sections of beautifully carved wood. This is the memorial to Edna Lyall.
SIR ROWLAND MORTON The first Grange was built by the Mortons. Sir Rowland Morton lived at the Grange and he was given the farm at the time his brother was Arch Bishop of Canterbury. The Grange was knocked down in 1889 and a new one built. Sir Rowland Morton founded the Morton chapel in 1530 when he founded the Grammar School .Sir Rowland Morton endowed a teacher to work in the Grammar school. At the moment Mr. Andrews owns the Grange. He has lived in Bosbury since 1932 which is 53 years ago. He was two when he came to
